messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] the last samurai
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yes, it s based (very loosely) on a true event, the Battle of Shiroyama, but had more differences than similarities. The last samurai of the film, Ken
messages.messageBody:
>in the movie, the last samurai, is it based on a true event? who was
>the last samurai?

Yes, it's based (very loosely) on a true event, the Battle of Shiroyama,
but had more differences than similarities.

The 'last samurai' of the film, Ken Watanabe's character (or Tom
Cruise's character, I guess...), is based on Saigo Takamori. As for
their being a single actual last samurai, no. All samurai alive at the
time became the last samurai as soon as the Meiji government did away
with the samurai caste.

-AngusH

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] the last samurai
messages.msgSnippet: Saigo Takamori was the leader of the Satsuma Rebellion.  I believe there is a book about him that refers to him at the last samurai . While I enjoyed the
messages.messageBody:
Saigo Takamori was the leader of the Satsuma Rebellion. I believe there is a book about him that refers to him at the "last samurai".

While I enjoyed the movie, it doesn't bare any relationship to history.

Bob Burke
